instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00928: What is 820-00928? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
Hi.

Background: LCD was not showing an image at all, an issue with the speaker, and also the battery was inflated. I ordered a new LCD original(just LCD) unglued the old one and tested it all the time with the new LCD. When powered on with or without battery it shows a picture, sometimes it goes to log in(with battery) and works for a bit and then turns off, and sometimes on loading, it will just restart. When it restarts sometimes it will show only the backlight, sometimes nothing. I found corroded CB 211 and removed it and also the row of <CAPACITOR>C3523</CAPACITOR> near <CHIP>U3500</CHIP>(resoldered all of them). I have replaced <CHIP>U9850</CHIP>(donor board), but still the same thing. I tried also a new battery just in case.  Note with the old LCD doesn't show a picture at all I tried it again after I tried with the new LCD. I noticed on the thermal camera it heats up around 55 degrees L7030 and <TRANSISTOR>Q7030</TRANSISTOR>. Also, the chipset sometimes goes up to 55-56degrees. 

Any ideas would be appreciated

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
55 degrees is not an elevated temperature.

Did you test in SMC bypass and safe mode?
Try new installation (from Internet Recovery) too.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: Once I try to go into Internet recovery it gets frozen with some colors on the World icon, and sometimes even gets frozen in Boot. The screen stay on normal and the trackpad clicks, fans are spinning normally just the screen freezes. I was doing some more testing this morning and encountered this mentioned above...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: After a while when the board will heat up it refuses to show even an image. I'm suspecting the GMux or in the worst case the GPU
